title: Getting help with natcpp
text: Thanks using natcpp. ’re sorry ’re trouble, don’t worry, ’re help! get help quickly possible, please read following:

title: Getting help with natcpp
text: first thing see anyone problem : Search nat-user google group. Search GitHub issues natcpp package. Search GitHub issues across whole natverse case problem related package. can add terms search search box top left page. solves problem, great!

title: Getting help with natcpp
text: need help known problem: found relevant thread nat-user google group: please reply . found GitHub issue: please reply details just like (click emoji button add thumbs ) let us know ’re trouble . ’ll need GitHub login . ’re sure: ask new question nat-user google group linking found.

title: Getting help with natcpp
text: looks like new problem : just question: please ask nat-user google group. need report new bug: please file issue. ’re sure: please just ask nat-user google group! problem bug feature request, can easily return report - may able point existing report workaround.

title: Getting help with natcpp
text: specific Include code triggered problem possible, make minimal reproducible example (reprex) much easier us help can run reprex machine without data. might want use sample data nat package help, refer publicly available data online. can use reprex package help prepare reprex. Read Get help! section tidyverse site information. Thanks help!

title: Authors and Citation
text: Gregory Jefferis. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jefferis G (2025). natcpp: Fast C++ Primitives 'NeuroAnatomy Toolbox'. R package version 0.1.1.9000, https://github.com/natverse/natcpp.
code: @Manual{,   title = {natcpp: Fast C++ Primitives for the 'NeuroAnatomy Toolbox'},   author = {Gregory Jefferis},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.1.9000},   url = {https://github.com/natverse/natcpp}, }

what: Fast C++ Primitives for the NeuroAnatomy Toolbox
title: Fast C++ Primitives for the NeuroAnatomy Toolbox
text: goal natcpp provide accelerated routines compiled C++ code basic functions support natverse computational neuroanatomy ecosystem. natcpp designed used end users instead nat package use available enable large speed-ups primitive operations. End users therefore count natcpp functions/interface stable, especially initial development. plan get onto CRAN quite quickly binary packages available Mac/Windows users full C compiler toolchain installed. CRAN, try keep package simple stable, infrequent updates. development version available via relevant github repository (see ). intend specify GitHub remote updates installed default .e. prefer CRAN binaries unless user intervenes.

title: Fast C++ Primitives for the NeuroAnatomy Toolbox
text: Install released version natcpp CRAN : development version, please :

title: Fast C++ Primitives for the NeuroAnatomy Toolbox
text: already noted, intention end users use nat package (automagically use natcpp available). However prove everything set properly, :

what: Turn a segment list into an edgelist suitable for constructing an ngraph — c_EdgeListFromSegList
title: Turn a segment list into an edgelist suitable for constructing an ngraph — c_EdgeListFromSegList
text: Turn segment list edgelist suitable constructing ngraph

title: Turn a segment list into an edgelist suitable for constructing an ngraph — c_EdgeListFromSegList
Turn a segment list into an edgelist suitable for constructing an ngraph — c_EdgeListFromSegList
text: L list containing integer vectors .seglist

title: Turn a segment list into an edgelist suitable for constructing an ngraph — c_EdgeListFromSegList
text: integer matrix N rows 2 columns

title: Turn a segment list into an edgelist suitable for constructing an ngraph — c_EdgeListFromSegList
text: caller generate seglist. Note isolated points dropped since edges.

title: Turn a segment list into an edgelist suitable for constructing an ngraph — c_EdgeListFromSegList
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(nat) # make a neuron with multiple subtrees n=prune_vertices(Cell07PNs[[1]], 48L) # Must use flatten=T if including all subtrees sl=as.seglist(n, all = TRUE, flatten = TRUE) c_EdgeListFromSegList(sl) } # }

what: Convert a matrix into list of row vectors — c_ListofMatrixRows
title: Convert a matrix into list of row vectors — c_ListofMatrixRows
text: Convert matrix list row vectors

title: Convert a matrix into list of row vectors — c_ListofMatrixRows
Convert a matrix into list of row vectors — c_ListofMatrixRows
text: object integer, numeric, character logical matrix N rows M columns

title: Convert a matrix into list of row vectors — c_ListofMatrixRows
text: list containing N vectors length M corresponding rows   object.

title: Convert a matrix into list of row vectors — c_ListofMatrixRows
text: Typically 3D coordinates limits   row length.

title: Convert a matrix into list of row vectors — c_ListofMatrixRows
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(nat) xyz=xyzmatrix(Cell07PNs) mat2list = function(m) { um=unname(m) lapply(1:nrow(um), function(i) um[i,]) } bench::mark(rcpp=c_ListofMatrixRows(xyz), r=mat2list(xyz)) } # }

what: Convert physical coordinates to 1d indices into image array — c_coords21dindex
title: Convert physical coordinates to 1d indices into image array — c_coords21dindex
text: Convert physical coordinates 1d indices image array

title: Convert physical coordinates to 1d indices into image array — c_coords21dindex
code: c_coords21dindex(xyz, origin, voxdims, dims, clamp = FALSE)

title: Convert physical coordinates to 1d indices into image array — c_coords21dindex
text: xyz Nx3 matrix data.frame physical coordinates origin Numeric: 3d coordinates origin voxdims Numeric: 3 numbers describing voxel dimensions dims Integer dimensions 3d image array clamp Logical: whether clamp values within pixel boundaries image.

title: Convert physical coordinates to 1d indices into image array — c_coords21dindex
text: Nx3 integer matrix pixel coordinates

title: Convert physical coordinates to pixel coordinates — c_ijkpos
text: xyz Nx3 matrix physical coordinates origin Numeric: 3d coordinates origin voxdims Numeric: 3 numbers describing voxel dimensions dims Integer dimensions 3d image array clamp Logical: whether clamp values within pixel boundaries image.

title: Convert physical coordinates to pixel coordinates — c_ijkpos
text: Nx3 integer matrix pixel coordinates

what: A simple function to compute the lengths of the elements of an R list — c_listlengths
title: A simple function to compute the lengths of the elements of an R list — c_listlengths
text: simple function compute lengths elements R list

title: A simple function to compute the lengths of the elements of an R list — c_listlengths
A simple function to compute the lengths of the elements of an R list — c_listlengths
text: L list

title: A simple function to compute the lengths of the elements of an R list — c_listlengths
text: integer vector containing length element L

title: A simple function to compute the lengths of the elements of an R list — c_listlengths
text: equivalent base::lengths however much faster long lists (somewhat slower short ones).

what: Compute summed segment lengths or total cable — c_seglengths
title: Compute summed segment lengths or total cable — c_seglengths
text: c_seglengths computes summed segment length equivalent  nat::seglengths(sumsegment = T) c_total_cable computes summed total cable whole neuron. intended use nat::summary.neuron function.

title: Compute summed segment lengths or total cable — c_seglengths
code: c_seglengths(sl, x, y, z)  c_total_cable(sl, x, y, z)

title: Compute summed segment lengths or total cable — c_seglengths
text: sl seglist 1-indices vectors x,y,z x, y, z Numeric vectors 3D coordinate data (columns data frame)

title: Find 1D index given n-dimensional indices — c_sub2ind
text: Find 1D index given n-dimensional indices

title: Find 1D index given n-dimensional indices — c_sub2ind
Find 1D index given n-dimensional indices — c_sub2ind
text: dims Integer dimensions array (usually 3d) indices Nx3 integer matrix pixel coordinates

title: Find 1D index given n-dimensional indices — c_sub2ind
text: numeric vector linear indices array

what: Find the first and last elements of all vectors in a list — c_topntail
title: Find the first and last elements of all vectors in a list — c_topntail
text: c_topntail returns 2xN matrix containing start end vectors input list. Length 0 vectors ignored, length 1 vectors duplicated c_topntail_list, list length L elements length <=2 first last elements length>2.

title: Find the first and last elements of all vectors in a list — c_topntail
Find the first and last elements of all vectors in a list — c_topntail
text: L list containing integer vectors, typically seglist

title: Find the first and last elements of all vectors in a list — c_topntail
text: c_topntail integer matrix. c_topntail_list   list.

what: natcpp: Fast C++ Primitives for the 'NeuroAnatomy Toolbox' — natcpp-package
title: natcpp: Fast C++ Primitives for the 'NeuroAnatomy Toolbox' — natcpp-package
text: Fast functions implemented C++ via 'Rcpp' support 'NeuroAnatomy Toolbox' ('nat') ecosystem. functions provide large speed-ups basic manipulation neuronal skeletons pure R functions found 'nat' package. expectation end users use package directly, instead 'nat' package automatically use routines package available enable large performance gains.

title: natcpp: Fast C++ Primitives for the 'NeuroAnatomy Toolbox' — natcpp-package
text: Maintainer: Gregory Jefferis jefferis@gmail.com (ORCID)

title: natcpp 0.1.1
text: adds c_ListofMatrixRows()

title: natcpp 0.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2021-07-13 First version package basic functions manipulating segment lists calculating cable lengths.
